description: Borrowed from Latin concurro (“to run together, agree”).

verbs.description: concur (third-person singular simple present concurs, present participle concurring, simple past and past participle concurred)

entries.meaning: To agree (in action or opinion); to have a common opinion; to coincide; to correspond.
examples: The jury concurs with the case put forward by the defence lawyer, that the defendant is undoubtedly innocent.
I do not concur that this is the best way forward.
We do not concur in that particular point.

entries.meaning: To meet in the same point; to combine or conjoin; to contribute or help towards a common object or effect.
